title: How to Shift from 1st to 2nd Gear in a Standard Transmission Car

steps.title: Listen for the change in your car's engine sounds that let you know it's "working harder."
steps.content: Listen for the change in your car's engine sounds that let you know it's "working harder." Higher pitched whirring is one sign. (Notice the RPM reading at that point, and you'll begin to develop a sense of when you need to shift gears in this car. Most cars need to be shifted whenever they hit 3000-3500 RPMs). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Lift your right foot off the pedals altogether--do not press the accelerator or brake pedal.
steps.content: Lift your right foot off the pedals altogether--do not press the accelerator or brake pedal. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Press the clutch pedal down quickly all the way to the floor or until you feel it dis-engage.
steps.content: Press the clutch pedal down quickly all the way to the floor or until you feel it dis-engage. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Smoothly pull the shift lever straight back from 1st to 2nd gear.
steps.content: Smoothly pull the shift lever straight back from 1st to 2nd gear. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Release the clutch smoothly and then continue pressing lightly on the accelerator.
steps.content: Release the clutch smoothly and then continue pressing lightly on the accelerator. Do not be harsh with either pedal - the ride will be jerky and you could put too much strain on the drive train. [5] X Research source
